headline: AEC Technology @ Symetri USA
about:
At Symetri USA, I harness my sales and construction expertise to expand our reach within the construction technology sector. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, we foster growth and client relationships, leveraging my experience from Procore Technologies and as a Construction Project Manager. 

My role as an Account Executive is marked by strategic lead generation, a consultive approach to SaaS selling, and nurturing key accounts, contributing to an increased market presence.

recommendations.description:
I've had the pleasure of working with Elizabeth for the past 2 years, and I was consistently impressed by her leadership skills, her knowledge of the construction market and the Procore platform, and her ability to motivate and inspire her team.

Under Elizabeth's leadership, the Procore LATAM Sales Development team consistently exceeded their goals, achieving record-breaking results. She did this by creating a positive and supportive work environment, where everyone felt valued and appreciated. She also provided her team with the tools and resources they needed to be successful, and she was always available to provide guidance and support.
In addition to her strong leadership skills, Elizabeth also has a deep understanding of the market and the product. She is always up-to-date on the latest trends and developments, and she is able to use this knowledge to help her team uncover more business opportunities.

I have no doubt that Elizabeth would be an asset to any sales team. She is a highly motivated and results-oriented individual with a proven track record of success. I highly recommend her for the position of Sales Development Manager, Advisor or Team Lead.

recommendations.name: Luciana Batallanos
recommendations.subtitle: Product Marketing Management | Strategic Brand Management l Marketing Management l B2B Sales & Marketing l SaaS Product Marketing
recommendations.context: Manuel worked with Luciana but on different teams
recommendations.description:
I highly recommend Luciana Batallanos as an accomplished Product Marketing Manager within the software industry. I have had the pleasure of working closely with Luciana for the past 2 years at Procore Technologies. During this time, we collaborated on various marketing initiatives, including launching new software products and implementing successful digital marketing campaigns to expand brand awareness in the LatAm region. 

One of Luciana's key strengths is her deep understanding of both the software and construction industries. Her extensive product knowledge allows her to develop targeted marketing strategies that effectively communicate the value of our software solutions to our target audience. Through her data-driven approach, she has consistently contributed to the improvement of our website's search engine rankings, resulting in a significant increase in organic traffic and lead generation.

Aside from her technical expertise, Luciana is also a natural leader with exceptional interpersonal skills. She has the ability to effectively communicate complex marketing concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, resulting in successful collaborations and alignment of goals. Her strong leadership skills and ability to motivate team members have consistently driven high-performance and exceptional results.

I have been consistently impressed with Luciana's ability to deliver outstanding marketing campaigns and drive business growth. Hence, I highly recommend her to any organization in need of a dedicated and accomplished Product Marketing Manager.

volunteerAndAwards.role: Startup Mentor, Angel Fund Manager & Investor
volunteerAndAwards.description:
The Seattle Angel Conference (SAC) is a semiannual investor-driven event, designed to increase angel investment capacity throughout King County and Western Washington. SAC is operated as a non-profit to teach investors for-profit angel investing techniques. During each conference a diverse group of seasoned and novice angel investors work together to create a new fund, engage in thorough due diligence of 50+ startups under consideration, and ultimately award their pooled investment dollars to one or more of the presenting finalists.

► Angel Investor in Seattle Angel Conference XVI, awarded to Xemelgo.

► Angel Investor and appointed pro bono Due Diligence Lead for Seattle Angel Conference XVII, awarded to Tribute and PDM Automotive.

► Angel Investor and appointed pro bono Fund Manager / Managing Partner for Seattle Angel Conference XVIII, awarded to Advice Analytics.

► Angel Investor and pro bono Fund Manager / Managing Partner for three additional SAC XVIII sidecar funds, awarded to AgTools, Advocat, and Kachinga respectively.

patents.title: Method and System of an Opinion Search Engine with an Application Programming Interface for Providing an Opinion Web Portal [via Trensant]
patents.subtitle: US 10,621,183 · Issued Dec 25, 2018
patents.description: Embodiments of the present disclosure are directed to meth­ods, computer program products, computer systems for providing a computing search platform for conducting opin­ion searches over the Internet concerning aggregated social media electronic messages about public opinions and public sentiments for a wide variety of matrices, such as social media posting of a particular industry over a specified time period, electronic social media posting on the public senti­ments, public buzz, and public mood. Methods and systems of the present disclosure are directed to collecting and analyzing unstructured social media messages and correlat­ing with structured entity representations in order to discern amount of interest in (buzz) and feelings about (mood) the real world organizations, people, products, and locations described by those entity representations transforming the data into a readily understandable visual display of the aggregated results on a computer display.

patents.title: Hybrid Human / Machine Learning System and Method [via Trensant]
patents.subtitle: US 9,471,883 B2 · Issued Oct 18, 2016
patents.description: Embodiments of the present invention provide a system, method, and article of hybrid human machine learning system with tagging and scoring techniques for sentiment magnitude scoring of textual passages. The combination of machine learning systems with data from human pooled language extraction techniques enable the present system to achieve high accuracy of human sentiment measurement and textual categorization of raw text, blog posts, and social media streams. This information can then be aggregated to provide brand and product strength analysis. A data processing module is configured to get streaming data and then tag the streaming data automatically using the machine learning output. A crowdsourcing module is configured to select a subset of social media posts that have been previously stored in the database, and present the social media posts on the web, which then tags each social media with a selected set of attributes. A score aggregator module configured to provide a score based on a user's feedback for each social media post.

recommendationsReceived.name: Joshua Rafael Sanchez

recommendationsReceived.context: Joshua Rafael reported directly to Erick
recommendationsReceived.description:
I am extremely fortunate to have had Erick as a mentor while I navigated the complexities of transitioning into product management, as well as being my boss at Randamu.  Erick is not only a wellspring of marketing knowledge and experience, but also an exemplary leader and fervent supporter of my growth as a product person.

Throughout my journey, I've learned greatly from his deep industry insight and a genuine commitment to nurturing the skills of those around him.  What stands out to me is his thoughtful, knowledgeable, and genuine approach, which I think is rare in the industry.  During times when I faced challenges in adjusting to launch my career from university, Erick put forward the extra encouragement and motivation, which were pivotal in helping me persevere and excel; for this point, it hard to express how thankful I am for this, especially during the tech recession.

Anyone who has the opportunity to work with his mentorship is indeed in excellent hands.  I will miss working with him at Randamu, and I cannot recommend highly enough -- he has been the go-to mentor for me. I look forward to great things in the future. Thank you Erick!

recommendations.subtitle: Strategic Design and Innovation Leader | Digital Identity, Currency & Trust Infrastructure | Innovation for Horizon 2-3 Projects
recommendations.context: Erick managed Andrew directly
recommendations.description:
Proposing that we hire Andrew Slack as our Head of Product was one of the best recommendations my Randamu co-founders ever made. I've deeply enjoyed working with Andrew during the past year while he served as Head of Product at our fledgeling web3 startup, Randamu. He has consistently been one of the most effective product leaders I’ve partnered with, and there have been many in my long career.

Andrew brings an unbounded curiosity to his work. He is relentless about understanding the "Why?" behind problems, technologies, and most importantly customer needs. Andrew's curiosity translated directly into better decisions and stronger products at Randamu. He pairs his curiosity with a solution-oriented, "glass-half-full" mindset, which is refreshing and helped to balance less optimistic personalities within our team. Even under extreme ambiguity or tight constraints, Andrew remains focused on forward motion and practical outcomes rather than yielding to blockers.

Most impressively, I appreciate how Andrew remains calm and clear-headed under extreme pressure. In high stakes situations including tight timelines, technical uncertainty, or shifting priorities, he was a stabilizing force for both engineering and leadership, consistently helping our team converge on sensible, profitable, and well-reasoned paths forward.

Andrew would be an exceptional addition to any software organization looking to fill a product leadership role, including larger enterprises such as Google or Microsoft. He combines intellectual rigor, emotional steadiness, and executional clarity in a way that’s rare and highly valued.

I would gladly work with Andrew again and recommend him without reservation.

recommendations.description: I worked very closely with James while at Edge by Ascential during my tenure as Director of Product.  During that time we collaborated seamlessly, ideating diverse visions with tactical follow-ups to breathe life into worthy ideas. James's ability to contribute as both a seasoned creative and an analytic technician is rare in the data science field and significantly enhanced the quality of our work. Beyond his individual contributions, James's team stood out in its exceptional collective quality, morale, and productivity. His team was comprised of passionate craftsmen who punched well above their weight. I would be delighted to work with James again, and I trust in his ability to bring the kind of innovative culture that is required when building world class products.

recommendations.name: Brian Lue
recommendations.subtitle: Co-Founder | AI + Clean Energy Infrastructure | Solar Rooftop & Carports, EV Charging & Resilient Community Energy (30+ Patents | Lifelong Environmental Advocate)
recommendations.context: Erick worked with Brian on the same team
recommendations.description:
During our years together at Moodwire, (f.k.a. - Metavana), Brian demonstrated himself to be an inspiring Start-up Founder and world-class Entrepreneur.

Brian embodies several outstanding character traits that are difficult to find in any one person, the combination of which is even more meaningful when present in the founder of a high technology start-up company:

* GRIT: when he has empirical evidence that his plan is correct, Brian simply does not give up or delay execution of his plan under any circumstances. Brian has determination and grit in situations that other, more delicate souls would find intolerable. Brian keeps his "eyes on the prize" and remains focused even under the most challenging circumstances.

* HUMILITY: Brian understands that it is often beneficial to put his own ego aside when working with others. With no task either above or below him, Brian focuses on what needs to get done in order to realize his vision as quickly and successfully as possible.

* FLEXIBILITY: Complimenting his single-minded determination is the ability to 'pivot' and change course when presented with data that justifies such a change. It's unusual to find someone who can be both "committed" and "flexible", but Brian insures that his actions are always guided by good data, thus, he is able to make changes and adjustments to his plans "on the fly" when he learns something new, or sees that something is not working quite right.

* CUSTOMER FOCUS: Brian starts every task with his end in mind, and this is a relentless focus on what is best for his customers.

In addition to his outstanding technical and engineering acumen, Brian is a diligent and conscientious co-worker who is simply a joy to be around. His earnest effort, professional demeanor, and great sense of humor make him a fantastic addition to any team.  I consider it my honor and a privilege to have worked with him, and I look forward to many years of fruitful partnership.  I know from experience that Brian will be successful at whatever he puts his mind to.

recommendations.name: Tapas Paul
recommendations.subtitle: Senior Sharepoint Developer at Novigo Solutions
recommendations.context: Erick managed Tapas directly
recommendations.description:
During our time together working on Moodwire.com, Tapas demonstrated himself to be an outstanding Software Development Engineer & Dev Lead.

Tapas led a complex software development project that resulted in deep integration of Moodwire's proprietary Text Analytics API with supporting API integrations, such as Microsoft Azure, Qlik Sense Desktop, Tableau, etc.  This project required him to become intimately familiar with both the Moodwire Text Analytics API, (viewable at http://www.moodwire.com/developer) as well as learning the appropriate Microsoft Azure, C#, Qlik & Tableau patterns and practices necessary to successfully integrate our API with various data providers and visualization packages.

In addition to his outstanding coding skills, Tapas is a diligent and conscientious co-worker who is simply a joy to work with. His earnest effort, professional demeanor, and great sense of humor make him a fantastic addition to any development team.  I consider it an honor and a privilege to work with him, and hope to work with him again in the near future.

recommendations.name: Rabia N.
recommendations.subtitle: Machine Learning Engineer & Leader
recommendations.context: Erick was senior to Rabia but didn't manage Rabia directly
recommendations.description:
Rabia Nuray-Turan has demonstrated herself to be a superlative Data Scientist, and all-around *amazing* human being!

During our several years working together, Rabia took Moodwire from an "idea on a whiteboard" to a text analysis pipeline handling *billions of transactions* per day. Few people are actually capable of this kind of work, and even fewer could make it happen. Rabia led multiple, complex data management and software development projects during this time that culminated in the development of Moodwire's proprietary Text Analytics API, along with several supported integrations to data providers such as Microsoft Azure, and Qlik Sense Desktop, Tableau Desktop, Domo, etc.  (You can check out some of the results at http://www.moodwire.com.) 

In addition to her outstanding coding skills, Rabia is a diligent and conscientious co-worker who is simply a joy to work with. I especially appreciated her tenacity and quiet resolve in the face of overwhelming challenges, and I often derived inspiration from her personal grit and steely determination. As just one remarkable example of Rabia's commitment to her vocation, a couple days after being *hit by a car* no less, she had her wrist in a cast, but was back in the office pecking at her keyboard without complaint! This is just one example of who Rabia is - a determined heroine who remains steadfast in the face of adversity.

In addition to her adamantine constitution, she is a curious and clever scientist who never backs down from a challenge. I considered it an honor and privilege to work with her, and I hope we have an opportunity to work together again in the very near future.

recommendations.name: Thais Minet
recommendations.subtitle: Mathematics and Software
recommendations.context: Erick managed Thais directly
recommendations.description:
Please be informed that Mr. Thais Minet was gainfully employed as a paid intern by Moodwire, Inc. during the Summer of 2016, (June through August), in the capacity of Software Development Engineer (SDE).

During his Summer Internship with Moodwire, Mr. Minet demonstrated himself to be an exceptionally capable and diligent software developer. The quality and volume of his productivity was especially noteworthy, given he had not yet completed his formal collegiate studies in Computer Science.

Lasting evidence of Mr. Minet’s singularly valuable contributions to Moodwire can be found at http://www.moodwire.com/developer and at http://api-docs.moodwire.com. He was solely responsible for delivering the company’s very first Developer Learning Portal, and further, he generated the company’s first formal application programming interface (API) documentation – a daunting task that was further complicated by the need to adhere to an international open source software (OSS) specification known colloquially as “Swagger”, the full details of which can be seen at http://www.swagger.io. 

Everyone at Moodwire, from our part-time staff, all the way up to the CEO and Chairman of the Board, wishes to express their deepest appreciation to Mr. Minet for his significant and lasting contributions to Moodwire’s success.  We hope to work together with him again in the future, and we wish him every success in his academic studies. Mr. Minet has a very promising career ahead of him, and we consider ourselves fortunate to have worked with him.

Very truly yours, 

Erick K. Watson
Chief Product Officer
Moodwire, Inc.

recommendations.subtitle: High energy, creative, problem solver. Currently focused on AI and music
recommendations.context: Erick worked with Jamie but on different teams
recommendations.description:
I worked with Jamie during a very exciting time in Microsoft's evolution. Open Source software was emerging as a major competitive threat for the company, and many at Microsoft were struggling to figure out what exactly that meant for them as well as their products & services. 

Jamie made an immediate impact by bringing a sense of calm professionalism to our virtual team that had previously been bordering on hysterics. His insightful analysis, confident and assured demeanor, and supportive partnership changed the entire tenor of our group. The team went from being confused, unfocused and ineffective to taking confident, clear and impactful actions. All of this was especially difficult considering Jamie was remote from the majority of the team at this time, based in NYC.

The months that I worked with Jamie and the Open Source Compete team were some of my very best at Microsoft. I recall Jamie as being clever, insightful, well-prepared for any contingency, with a great sense of humor who influenced, often without authority, to keep everyone rowing in the same direction.  I would gladly work with Jamie again at a moment's notice.

recommendations.name: Frederica Carpenter
recommendations.subtitle: Sales Manager at Vineyard Gazette Media Group
recommendations.context: Erick worked with Frederica but on different teams
recommendations.description:
One of the most challenging career paths I have ever witnessed is to become a leading solutions marketer at a large, complex, and product-oriented company such as Microsoft. Few experienced marketers could even begin to tackle such a Herculean task, let alone with enthusiasm and panache. Fortunately for Microsoft, Frederica Carpenter is one such person.

Frederica is a rare soul who blends iron-willed determination to accomplish her aim with the agility and good graces to succeed in an ever-changing, politically-charged environment. I was often impressed by how adroitly she could manage a room full of conflicting "Type A" personalities and yet still achieve tangible results. 

Few industries are as competitive and unforgiving as Financial Services, but this is a millieu in which she excells. I especially appreciated her command of industry trends, her ability to negotiate with and manage difficult, often recalcitrant customers and partners, bridging the differences between many different interests, all the while making everyone feel like winners. Her skills at negotiation and conflict resolution are second to none. I would eagerly work with Frederica again at a moment's notice.

Ericka brought an unflappable enthusiasm and 'can-do' attitude to our working sessions, demonstrating her talent for solving complex problems in novel and unexpected ways. Ericka was able to synthesize a myriad of complex inputs and come up with effective solutions to enhancing the reach and impact of the SAO's programs in situations where ordinary observers would say it 'couldn't be done'. Ericka taught me that often the power of our whole organization could easily exceed the sum of its parts, and for that I will be eternally grateful. I would gladly work with Ericka again and wish her the best in her future endeavors.

experiences.jobDescription:
Best Doctors, Inc. (www.bestdoctors.com) is the trusted expert medical resource that helps people take control of their healthcare. By connecting members and their treating physicians with world- renowned experts to confirm the right diagnosis and the right treatment, Best Doctors has a dramatic impact on the quality and cost of healthcare. 

The company delivers comprehensive, patient-centric, expert advice, empowering members and their physicians with specific, pertinent, actionable information. Better than a traditional second opinion, Best Doctors delivers a comprehensive evaluation of a member’s medical condition — providing value to both its members and their treating physicians. 

When patients face a medical decision, they have questions: 

• Is this diagnosis right? 
• Is this medication right for my condition? 
• Is surgery my best option? 
• What is the best treatment? 

Globally, Best Doctors delivers this benefit through health insurance products that are transforming the industry. 
In Canada, Best Doctors services are available as a health benefit through leading employers. Complementary to an employee’s current health plan or care management program, Best Doctors healthcare decision support service puts individuals in charge of their health and gives them access to the best experts and medical information through a network of 50,000 “best in their field” expert physicians.

Created and implemented the software development strategy using secure methods and tools to ensure that our product which was developed globally was of the highest quality and most secure every day, every release.  We were very proud of a "never compromised" record for my tenure at Websense.
Oversaw planning, development, and management of R&D and network environments; products revolved around web filtering, data leakage prevention, and malicious attack software in San Diego, Los Gatos, UK, China, and Israel. 
Managed team of 16 geographically dispersed engineers, network administrators, and project manager, coordinated global infrastructure, and guided release operations.
Led transition to private cloud for R&D with on-demand server instantiation, charge back to departments, managed expirations, and automated monitoring/alerting; reduced amount of hardware needed to run engineering operations.
Managed transition of R&D infrastructure from UK to China, led technology and headcount evaluation, and oversaw integration of new products, source code, and defect tracking systems; ensured no loss in technical support and maintained company-wide development schedule.

updates.postText:
I traveled 4,000+ miles to stay with an internet friend

I didn’t realize how much I was missing until I landed in London

This was my FIRST time abroad
and within hours 
it stopped feeling like a trip 
started feeling like I was living in a movie

I finally met Sasha Cayward - MSc. from Hubble in person!

She started a dinner series called 

Outliers

She brings top founders, investors and operators into a private house 
and cooks dinner... like fully cooks 

The philosophy is simple: shoes off & no phones 

I've never had the depth of conversation as I did that night 
nothing was off limits 

And I met some of the coolest people who are now friends 

Luke Nelmes - building the future of paid social
James P. Apple's first engineer in Europe & Hubble expert 
Gabriel Shalom a brilliant creative
Viraj Acharya - building the future of venture media 
Zafar Bhunnoo - launching a $1B fund... 

And many more amazing founders

The conversations got so good 
that Gabriel Shalom and I hit record 
and ran an impromptu podcast

My favorite part of this trip was my co-founder Gowthaman Ravindrathas

After months of building
through screens
time zones
discord calls

it finally clicked why people say you can’t replace in-person.

Ideas move faster
Trust compounds
Community becomes real

This trip reminded me why I’m building in the first place and truly how much community matters.

Thank you Kevin Jurovich for building such an amazing platform that has allowed me to meet such amazing people like Bettina Briz, Craig Brown, James P. and many more!

P.S: Kevin Jurovich you couldn't have made a better hire than Sasha Cayward - MSc. ;) 

P.P.S. if you read this far ty <3

You can’t fake community

Yesterday, I talked with Kevin Jurovich

He played in the NFL.
Became a manager at Wells Fargo.
And now he’s building one of the most authentic online communities at Hubble 

We talked about the need for real connection 
not vanity metrics or follower counts,
but people who actually show up for each other.

And I’ve seen that power firsthand.
We met our advisor Bettina Briz through Hubble  
One conversation can change everything.

Seeing what Kevin Jurovich is building inspires me every day at Wavelink 

Because we’re building the same kind of foudation
a true community where creators and brands don’t just connect,
they grow together.

If you’re in the creator economy, let’s connect!

“The future looks crimson”
Day 4/30 of Sasha Cayward - MSc. challenge.

P.S. if you read this far, ty!

updates.postText:
Insightful conversations at the HFMA Southern Exchange in Lake Charles last week.

The CFO panel reinforced a clear shift in hospital finance: this is a margin protection environment, not growth at all costs. Payer mix pressure from Medicare Advantage, rising denials, and persistent labor and supply costs are forcing tighter capital discipline and sharper technology ROI scrutiny.

Key takeaways:
Revenue pressure is accelerating as denials rise and net revenue compresses despite higher volumes.
Cash discipline is critical, with focus on days in AR, aging, and capital governance.
AI has moved from “nice to have” to essential, especially across denials and front-end revenue cycle work.
CFOs are now operational partners, balancing financial stewardship with execution and long-term sustainability.

Strong networking throughout the week and a golf tournament win with my partner Chad Cassidy made it even better.

Appreciate everyone who made Southern Exchange a great event. Looking forward to turning these insights into action.

HFMA Texas Gulf Coast Chapter  
HFMA Texas State Chapters  
HFMA Lone Star Chapter 
Louisiana Chapter of HFMA 
 
#HFMA
#HealthcareFinance

A powerful kickoff to 2026 at the HFMA Western Region Symposium in Las Vegas.

This year’s theme, “Lead Now,” could not have been more relevant. Across every conversation we had at the Parathon booth and throughout the conference, it was clear that health system leaders are no longer waiting for perfect conditions, they are acting now to gain control of revenue and financial performance.

Parathon was proud to sponsor and participate in a forum where real operators are making real decisions about how to modernize their revenue operations.

Thank you to everyone who stopped by the booth, shared their priorities, and engaged in thoughtful conversations about what it means to Lead Now in today’s healthcare environment.

If we didn’t connect in Vegas or you’d like to continue the conversation, I’m always open to a follow up.

#HFMA #LeadNow #HealthcareFinance #RevenueCycle #AIinHealthcare

Grateful for the opportunity to attend and connect at the HFMA Lone Star Summit.

A big thank you to the organizers, speakers, and every healthcare finance leader who stopped by to share insights on the challenges and opportunities shaping revenue cycle today. The level of engagement around compliance, denials, and financial sustainability truly underscores the importance of collaboration across our industry.

Events like these remind me why I’m passionate about driving meaningful outcomes for providers and patients alike. I’m looking forward to building on the conversations we started in Texas and continuing to explore how innovative approaches can move the needle for health systems nationwide.

Special shoutout to my namesake, Sergio Quiej for the great conversations and energy throughout the event! 

HFMA Lone Star Chapter  
HFMA Texas State Chapters
Healthcare Financial Management Association (HFMA)  
#HFMA #HealthcareFinance #RevenueCycle #LoneStarSummit

headline: Helping owner-led dental practices ensure new patients feel confident choosing them before they even call.
about:
Owner-led dental practices don’t lose new patients because of clinical quality.
They lose them when subtle hesitation shows up before a decision is made.

Before a patient ever calls or books, they evaluate your practice online, quickly and quietly. 

When something feels unclear, outdated, or inconsistent, confidence drops. 
Patients rarely explain why. 
They just keep looking.

I help dental practices ensure new patients feel confident choosing them through a free Growth Readiness Audit — a short, live diagnostic that examines how your practice is experienced online before a patient ever reaches out.

The audit is not a sales call and not a marketing pitch.
Sometimes it confirms everything is working as it should.
More often, it reveals one or two specific readiness gaps that may be quietly slowing bookings.

If improvements make sense, we discuss them only with permission, based on your goals, budget, and risk tolerance. If not, the clarity still stands.

No hype.
No pressure.
Just a clear read on whether your online presence supports confident new patient decisions.

While my work focuses primarily on dental practices, our Trust Marketing System also applies to other trust-sensitive services where credibility and emotional safety are required before engagement.

experiences.title: Owner
experiences.jobDescription:
Trust System Architect for Owner-Led Dental Practices.
I help owner-led dental practices become the trusted choice before new patients ever call.

My work focuses on how prospective patients interpret a practice in the first moments of discovery.

Using a structured Trust System, I identify and repair trust leaks across the key decision signals patients rely on:
	•	Website tone, clarity, and emotional safety
	•	First-impression signals (the “first 3 seconds”)
	•	Visual consistency and modernity
	•	Google Business Profile accuracy and completeness
	•	Search presence alignment
	•	Review quality and pattern (not just volume)
	•	Compliance-conscious, human messaging

This work does not rely on hype or aggressive marketing.
It replaces guesswork with clarity so patients feel safe choosing the practice.

Outcome:
More confident inquiries, shorter decision cycles, and steadier new patient flow — because trust is clear before contact.

experiences.title: Leader
experiences.jobDescription: Group mentor supporting business owners in establishing strong trust-first positioning, clear messaging, and credibility-aligned systems for growth.

experiences.title: Owner
experiences.jobDescription:
Consulting focused on operational clarity, trust-based leadership, and systems thinking.

This work laid the foundation for the Trust System framework — emphasizing consistency, alignment, and decision safety across complex, high-responsibility environments.

experiences.title: Vice President of Operations
experiences.jobDescription: Led operational excellence initiatives emphasizing clarity, consistency, and trust: The foundation of my later Trust System philosophy. Built cross-department alignment systems that reduced friction and increased customer confidence.

experiences.title: Senior Operations Manager
experiences.jobDescription: Oversaw operations within a highly structured, compliance-sensitive environment. Developed process discipline, trust-by-design workflows, and clarity-first communication: all core to the Trust System methodology.

experiences.title: Director of IT and Managed Services

updates.postText:
Most dental practices don’t have a marketing problem.

They have a new-patient trust visibility problem.

The clinical care is strong.
The standards are high.
The team does good work.

But in the first few seconds online, that reality doesn’t always come through.

Before a patient ever calls or books, they subconsciously assess:
•	Does this practice feel calm and credible?
•	Does it look modern, clean, and consistent?
•	Do I feel safe taking the next step here?

Subtle signals — tone, visual consistency, Google presence, reviews, and social profiles — quietly shape that decision.

When something feels off, patients don’t complain.
They hesitate.
They compare.
They drift elsewhere.

This doesn’t show up in analytics.
It shows up as slower decisions and softer inquiries.

I help dental practices see how they’re experienced online before a new patient ever reaches out — and identify where small trust gaps may be quietly slowing momentum.

No hype.
No gimmicks.
Just clarity, before growth depends on it.

Photo by Joshua Hoehne on Unsplash

about: It is my belief that every aspect of a good design should come together to tell a story—from the colour palette to the choice of typeface, each element unites with the next to evoke an emotion specific to the design's purpose. I pride myself in helping businesses, brands and organizations to explore and showcase their unique stories, both visually and philosophically.

headline: Sales Leader | GenAi Solutions | B2B Sales Consulting  | USAF Veteran
about:
Enterprise Sales Leader with 10+ years of experience driving revenue growth across SaaS, Cloud, AI, and digital transformation initiatives. I specialize in complex B2B sales cycles, enterprise accounts, and go to market execution for technology solutions tied to measurable business outcomes.

My background spans enterprise software sales, AI and GenAI solutions, cloud platforms, iPaaS, automation, and API driven integration. I work at the intersection of business and technology, translating executive priorities into scalable revenue strategies and repeatable pipeline performance.
I bring deep expertise across the full sales lifecycle:
✅ Prospecting and account planning.
✅ Executive discovery and solution alignment.
✅ Technical validation, demos, and POCs.
✅ Commercial negotiation and contract execution.
✅ Pipeline forecasting and quota delivery.
✅ Core focus areas include enterprise SaaS sales, AI enabled automation, cloud transformation, and digital modernization initiatives. I consistently exceed quota targets, ranging from 120 to 140 percent, through disciplined pipeline generation, strategic account expansion, and new logo acquisition in competitive markets.
✅ I partner closely with technical teams, product leaders, and executives to align solutions with real operational needs. My strength is positioning AI, cloud, and automation investments in language executives trust, tied to efficiency, risk reduction, and revenue impact.
I am known for sales leadership, virtual execution, and operating effectively in remote enterprise environments. I coach teams, influence stakeholders, and build long term client relationships grounded in trust and results.
✅ US Air Force veteran with a strong foundation in leadership, accountability, and execution. I bring grit, focus, and consistency to every engagement.
If you are building enterprise revenue, scaling SaaS growth, or modernizing go to market strategy with AI and cloud technologies, I bring the experience to help drive outcomes.

Core responsibilities and focus.
Designed and deployed agentic AI sales agents using generative AI and machine learning to automate outbound engagement, qualification, and follow up.
Delivered AI powered outreach programs for B2B sales teams to increase meeting volume, response rates, and sales efficiency.

Supported custom AI and automation projects aligned to client GTM strategy and operational goals.

Technology and solution scope.
Agentic AI workflows and orchestration.
Generative AI automations and ML based agent builds.
B2B sales engagement and lead generation systems.
Revenue focused AI integrations.
Cybersecurity advisory through Juno partnership, including Zero Trust, threat detection, ransomware prevention, IAM, CMMC, ITAR, and NIST alignment.

Worked closely with SMB and mid market leadership teams to operationalize AI responsibly, focusing on measurable outcomes, compliance, and sustainable revenue impact.

Partnered with clients to design integrated, best of breed IT strategies that reduced complexity, improved scalability, and supported long term profitability across hybrid and multi platform environments.

headline: Helping B2B Brands Stand Out at Trade Shows | Senior Business Development Manager at Skyline Exhibits | Driving ROI Through Strategy, Design & Engagement | 20+ Years in Sales, Marketing & Experience Design
about:
You get one shot at a first impression on the trade show floor. I make sure it counts.

I help B2B companies create high-impact trade show experiences that attract more attendees, start better conversations, and generate real revenue — not just foot traffic.

With 20+ years in sales, business development, design, and marketing, I’ve learned one truth:👉 A booth isn’t a structure. It’s a strategy.

Your exhibit either accelerates pipeline… or blends into the noise.

At Skyline Exhibits, I partner with brands to: Clarify their message, Elevate their visual presence, Build attendee engagement, Reduce the stress of trade show planning, Make ROI measurable and repeatable.

What makes my approach different? A blend of strategy, psychology, and creativity from decades of leading sales teams, designing experiences, and helping brands grow through better storytelling and stronger execution

If you’re planning a trade show and need:
✔ A smarter booth strategy
✔ A new 10x10, 10x20, or 20x20
✔ A full island design
✔ Rental + turnkey services
✔ A long-term exhibit partner who thinks beyond the specs

Then I’m someone worth talking to.

Let’s build something visitors remember — and competitors fear.

experiences.title: Senior Business Development Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
I help B2B companies design and execute trade show programs that increase visibility, strengthen brand presence, and generate measurable ROI.

What I deliver:

Strategic booth planning (inline, peninsula, island)

Custom & rental exhibit solutions

Engagement concepts that stop attendees in their tracks

Full-service support: design → build → logistics → storage

Reliable ongoing partnership across multiple shows per year

My approach blends business development, marketing, and experience design to help exhibitors get more from every show.

My role was to reach out to high-end prospects and secure donations in the five-figure dollar range or higher, which meant making captivating speeches at events attended by 30 to 300+ people, cold-calling potential donors, and crafting compelling cold emails.

Feedback from Campaign Consultant: "You’re such a go-getter!!  Your effort and tenacity is most impressive, and I’ve done a lot of campaigns!!"

publications.title: Trade Show Tips for Island Exhibitors
publications.summary:
Exhibiting in an island trade show space is a major marketing commitment- the costs are larger, the expectations higher, and the risks greater...but so is the potential.

Click the link to download this free 60-page book including 26 articles on exhibit design, booth staffing, promotions, lead management, measurement, and more.

publications.title: Trade Show Tips for New Exhibitors
publications.summary:
Being new to trade show management or trade show exhibiting doesn't have to be a walk in the dark- these insights will allow you to shorten your learning curve and make the beginning of your trade show journey more of a walk in the park!

Click the link to receive this free 44-page book that includes 25 articles on trade show marketing, booth staff training, exhibit design, promotions, and more.

publications.title: Trade Show Tips for Inline Exhibitors
publications.summary:
Just because you exhibit in an inline space doesn't mean you can't stand out - but it also doesn't mean you get a free pass. You have to do your part to succeed, and this 56-page book is your guide to navigating the trade show jungle.

Click the link to download 25 free articles on exhibit design, booth staffing, promotions, lead management, measurement, and more to guide your exhibiting program through the trade show jungle!

publications.title: Using Promotions & Social Media to Get More Trade Show Visitors
publications.summary:
While social media has influenced the art of event marketing and trade show promotion, the ultimate success of any campaign or effort is the quality of the concept and content.. With attendees only spending measurable time at about 5% of exhibits, exhibitors need to stand out from the crowd to get those valuable visitors out of the aisle and into their booth.

Click the link to receive this free book including 28 articles on event promotions, integrating social media, interactive multimedia attractions, gaining brand awareness, and more.

recommendationsReceived.name: Matthew Rivoire
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Connecting Shopify Brands to Consumers through Conversational SMS
recommendationsReceived.context: Matthew reported directly to Robert
recommendationsReceived.description:
I think everyone at some point in their career hopes they’re lucky enough to have a mentor who changes the trajectory of their career. For me, that person is Bob Vail. He’s been one of the most influential leaders and creative sales minds I’ve ever had the privilege of working with. As a rep, Bob was world class. His consultative approach and creative solutions he provided merchants led him to massive success. Every rep looked to him for guidance to up their game. He was dedicated to his craft and helping others raise the bar. He set the standard for reps and I feel like thats what any org can expect from Bob. 


Shortly after I arrived, Privy was going through some changes and a reshuffle was in order. I was fortunate enough to land under Bob’s leadership, and It was exactly what I needed. I was hungry to grow, but I was raw. Bob has a natural talent for leading reps to their own voice in sales. Too often sales leaders want carbon copies of themselves. His patient and humble guidance - attention to detail breaking down every aspect of my process - challenging me to reach my potential - this is something I know every rep Isn’t lucky enough to have. He’s a huge reason for my own success and would jump at any opportunity to work with him again. I can’t recommend him enough. A true pro who would level up any sales org he’s associated with.

His ability to read his buyers, identify pain, handle objections, and position value is unparalleled. Sales is in his blood. I hired Bob initially as a rep, and he was consistently at the top of the leader boards. I then promoted him to team lead, then sales manager as we grew the org. The passion and dedication he brings to the table is infectious. His team and I loved working with him, and I would recommend him to anyone looking to scale their sales team.

His intelligent, well prepared, and data-driven approach helped ThriveHive scale our customer base at a very important phase of the business lifecycle.  Bob understands how to frame a conversation to not only deliver the value of the product but more importantly how to solve for the customer above all else.  Bob continues to illustrate the traits of a true pro through life reps, professional growth and continued company-wide contributions.

This made Bob great at acquiring new accounts, but also great at ensuring the account retained and upgraded. His customer success colleagues loved getting his accounts!

Outside of being an effective individual contributor, Bob is the kind of person that makes teams great. He's really personable and regularly shared best practices on ways we could solve for additional customer pain with our products. I'd highly recommend Bob, especially for any type of client facing role.

We didn't have a completed playbook, organized systems, or an easy road to success what so ever. Through his leadership, each member of our team was able to level up exponentially faster than any of us had previously at other organizations. He has a keen ability to inspire those around them to step up, and do what they need to do to succeed (and have fun doing it). For that, I am incredibly thankful.

I would highly recommend Ted to any organization that is seeking a true leader, and more importantly a kind person who brings up everyone around him. Looking forward to all of Ted's future success.

Through Jason's guidance, I left ThriveHive a different person in terms of business acumen, understanding of the digital landscape, and running a high value sales process. Although his career success speaks for itself, he's also an exceptional person. He stays true to himself and rarely falls into groupthink mentality that hurt businesses time and time again. ThriveHive has grown from a 20 person startup in a basement to an organization achieving public recognition, a lot of which can be attributed to Jason's direct impact. I highly recommend Jason to any organization that wants a truly driven intellect, and an overall better leader, who builds up everyone he works with.

headline: CFO Avocat | Bring clarity to high-stakes corporate real estate decisions.  Data Center, HQ, Office, Industrial and Logistics.   ✅ Performance Guaranteed.
about:
Most business real estate projects don’t derail because leaders pick the wrong property. They derail because objectives aren’t clear, stakeholders aren’t aligned, and teams underestimate the ripple effects.

A single CRE decision can affect 74 operational areas: talent/labor, incentives, productivity, flexibility, culture, and risk.

👉 Avocat Group helps executives gain clarity on business real estate projects, define objectives that directly support business strategy, and bring the full team together to “stack hands” on the same outcomes.

We offer free use of our CRE ClarityKit™—a set of decision tools that aligns leaders early, surfaces hidden impacts, and eliminates negative surprises: https://app.claritykit.ai/

This methodology was built from studying 800+ firms across 4,200+ projects in all 50 U.S. states plus Canada, Mexico, and 20 other global markets. Clients include Akin Gump, BellSouth, Wilson Sonsini, Sprint, Transamerica, DLA Piper, SunTrust, McKesson, and UPS.

Credibility: 100+ articles on Corporate Facility Strategy, keynote speaker (Florida Institute of CFOs, SIOR), featured in Bloomberg, Businessweek, CFO Magazine, U.S. News & World Report, Forbes, and more.

What you’ll get by following me:
🚀 Actionable ways to turn CRE into a competitive advantage
🔥 Clear, practical guidance (no fluff)
💼 Trends in real estate strategy, AI, and smart industry trends

Questions? I offer my connections a free, no‑obligation consult with tactics you can use immediately.

wb@avocatgroup.com
 | AvocatGroup.com

experiences.title: Chief Financial Officer
experiences.jobDescription:
Avocat Group is a consulting firm offering real estate strategies to the successful companies looking to improve profitability by leveraging their corporate real estate.  Avocat helps guide firms to transform their real estate to Hybrid Work by creating great spaces that support operations and minimize facility cost/risk while improving flexibility and ROI.

Avocat Group gives clients a single, reliable, point of contact to find, negotiate, and deliver facilities anywhere throughout the world and has more than 500 advisors strategically distributed across all 50 states and most major countries.  Our clients served include Akin Gump, BellSouth, Wilson Sonsini, Sprint, Transamerica, DLA Piper, CoreStates Financial, Squire Sanders, Spalding Sports, SunTrust Bank, Radio Disney, Evenflo Baby Products, Kforce, PSS World Medical, McKesson, and UPS in locations as diverse as Moscow, Caracas, Beijing and Abu Dhabi. 

Rather than use expensive commissioned real estate agents in expensive brick and mortar offices, Avocat Group uses smarter software and long standing relationships with industry leaders to empower business space users to control their leased facilities free from the the ethical and financial conflicts found when utilizing most large commercial real estate firms. This allows their clients to lower real estate costs, drive revenue growth, attract and retain staff, and minimize business risk.

Learn more about our scope of services at Avocatgroup.com

experiences.title: Founder
experiences.jobDescription: LeasingBetter™ is devoted to the open-source sharing of best practices related to the leasing of commercial real estate by business space users, rather than commercial landlords or developers.  We want to crowd-source the very best lessons learned, stories, and specific strategies to minimize cost and risk, maximize flexibility and negotiating leverage and fully utilize real estate to provide a competitive advantage for the corporate tenant.  Topics may cover any aspect of lease strategy including layout and design, lease negotiation, site selection, use of demographics or labor analytics, legal issues, market rates and trends, construction advice and value engineering, and financial structuring.  We connect corporate space users with professional RE advisors and provide them with a platform to communicate and analyze space opportunities through our iPhone and Android phone apps.

experiences.title: Interim Chief Financial Officer
experiences.jobDescription: Responsible for managing revenue strategy, identifying funding opportunities, programmatic budgeting, and assuring cost effective service delivery.  Monitor compliance with all contractual and programmatic requirements.  Oversee the management of all fiscal reporting activities for the organization.
